member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_SHORTPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the standard short (8.3 format) file name.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_UNCPRIORITY
member.summary: Retrieves the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path name of the file.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_RAWPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the raw path name. A raw path is something that might not exist and may include environment variables that need to be expanded.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, the high-order word of fFlags can be set to a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds). To specify a value, set the high word of fFlags to the desired time-out duration, in milliseconds.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine, whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media, across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to track remote file systems, whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

member.name: F:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_INVOKE_MSI
member.summary: Call the Microsoft Windows Installer

member.name: M:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.Resolve_Ui(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Resolves the target of a shortcut. If shortcut can't be resolved, an error message would be displayed. This is usefull when the target path of a shortcut file is changed from a driveletter for example, then the shortcut file need to be resolved before trying to retrieve the target path.
member.param: The shortcut file to resolve.
The new handle pointer that would be generated for the window which should display the error message (if any).

member.name: M:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.Resolve_NoUi(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the target of a shortcut. If shortcut can't be resolved, any error message would be displayed. This is usefull when the target path of a shortcut file is changed from a driveletter for example, then the shortcut file need to be resolved before trying to retrieve the target path.
member.param: The shortcut file to resolve.

member.name: M:InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.HotkeyModifiers,System.Windows.Forms.Keys,InstallerSetup.ShortcutManager.ShortcutWindowState)
member.summary: Creates a shortcut file.
member.param: The filepath to create the shortcut.
The target file or directory.
The working directory os the shortcut.
The shortcut description.
The target file arguments. This value only should be set when target is an executable file.
The icon location of the shortcut.
The icon index of the icon file.
The hotkey modifier(s) which should be used for the hotkey combination. can be one or more modifiers.
The key used in combination with the for hotkey combination.
The Window state for the target.
